item.title: Spielplan Oper Graz - corporate publishing
item.description: Due to renovation Oper Graz had to leave the opera building for the new season. Therefore moodley composed the opera world between packing cases, wool, electric cables and packaging material. Season's brochure and folder by moodley brand identity. CREDITS Client:Opernhaus Graz GmbH Managing director: Elisabeth Sobotka Texts: Eva Bucht, Birgit Amlinger, Bernd Krispin Creative direction: Mike Fuisz Artdirection and graphic design: Wolfgang Niederl Photography:Croce&Wir Production:Medienfabrik Graz Product Photography: Marion Luttenberger
item.content:encoded: Due to renovation Oper Graz had to leave the opera building for the new season. Therefore moodley composed the opera world between packing cases, wool, electric cables and packaging material. Season's brochure and folder by moodley brand identity. CREDITS Client:Opernhaus Graz GmbH Managing director: Elisabeth Sobotka Texts: Eva Bucht, Birgit Amlinger, Bernd Krispin Creative direction: Mike Fuisz Artdirection and graphic design: Wolfgang Niederl Photography:Croce&Wir Production:Medienfabrik Graz Product Photography: Marion Luttenberger

item.title: Vitra ID Chair Concept Campaign
item.description: karlssonwilker inc. designed and produced Vitras branding for Antonio Citterios ID Chair Concept. The ID Chair Concept is a radical departure from standardized office chairs and delivers limitless configurations and customizable options. The campaign is based on a universe of identities with three main animations, Rollercoaster, Space and Cruise, as the basis for the creative. Applications include animations, a microsite/chair configurator, catalogs, online/print advertisements, store/trade show displays, and various product support films/material. Studio: karlssonwilker inc. Project: ID Chair Concept Client: Vitra AG Credits: Nicole Jacek (art direction & design), Hjalti Karlsson (art direction), Catarina Carreiras and Julius Terlinden (design), Wardenclyffe (programming chair configurator and microsite), COMA (music), Baldur Helgasson & Sandra Ferreira (animation & retouching), Goodbye Limits (3D renderings & animation), Nrecaj Bewegte Bilder (photography), GZD and Netzwerk P (print production), Elisabeth Smolarz and Aline Stieger (photography)
item.content:encoded: karlssonwilker inc. designed and produced Vitras branding for Antonio Citterios ID Chair Concept. The ID Chair Concept is a radical departure from standardized office chairs and delivers limitless configurations and customizable options. The campaign is based on a universe of identities with three main animations, Rollercoaster, Space and Cruise, as the basis for the creative. Applications include animations, a microsite/chair configurator, catalogs, online/print advertisements, store/trade show displays, and various product support films/material. Studio: karlssonwilker inc. Project: ID Chair Concept Client: Vitra AG Credits: Nicole Jacek (art direction & design), Hjalti Karlsson (art direction), Catarina Carreiras and Julius Terlinden (design), Wardenclyffe (programming chair configurator and microsite), COMA (music), Baldur Helgasson & Sandra Ferreira (animation & retouching), Goodbye Limits (3D renderings & animation), Nrecaj Bewegte Bilder (photography), GZD and Netzwerk P (print production), Elisabeth Smolarz and Aline Stieger (photography)

item.title: Art Installation Japan
item.description: Photography for an installation in Towada art center, Aomori, Japan , about School Bullying. The curator ask me to make a ArtWork about this subject. The installation is big canvas on the wall of 1,2 meter height and 7 meter long with eye of children looking on the other wall. On the other wall all the drawing of these children about bullying.
item.content:encoded: Photography for an installation in Towada art center, Aomori, Japan , about School Bullying. The curator ask me to make a ArtWork about this subject. The installation is big canvas on the wall of 1,2 meter height and 7 meter long with eye of children looking on the other wall. On the other wall all the drawing of these children about bullying.

item.title: I Can't Seem to Get Rid of the Horses
item.description: The collection is a transformation of her own recurring childhood fantasies of wild horse adventures into wearable jewellery pieces. The pieces are a physical manifestations of surreal equestrian creatures, reminiscing early childhood fantasies made up sitting underneath her grandmothers kitchen table. The repeating horse figures place emphasis on the reoccurrence of her own infantile world of make-believe. The collection contains various neck pieces, rings, hoop earrings, bracelet. All hand made by the designer. All gold plated.
item.content:encoded: The collection is a transformation of her own recurring childhood fantasies of wild horse adventures into wearable jewellery pieces. The pieces are a physical manifestations of surreal equestrian creatures, reminiscing early childhood fantasies made up sitting underneath her grandmothers kitchen table. The repeating horse figures place emphasis on the reoccurrence of her own infantile world of make-believe. The collection contains various neck pieces, rings, hoop earrings, bracelet. All hand made by the designer. All gold plated.

item.title: Special Hommage Norman Rockwell
item.description: I love the picture of American artist Norman Rockwell. If you look at his paintings have a sense of humor, yet serious, and there is a message. And enough of the colors and the figures are too fond of the expression.
item.content:encoded: I love the picture of American artist Norman Rockwell. If you look at his paintings have a sense of humor, yet serious, and there is a message. And enough of the colors and the figures are too fond of the expression.

item.title: Division of Industrial Design
item.description: In 2011, The Division of Industrial Design at National University of Singapore, gained independence from the Department of Architecture. In line with this transformation, we designed the division's identity, brand guidelines and a retrospective book to celebrate their 2010 - 2011 achievements.
item.content:encoded: In 2011, The Division of Industrial Design at National University of Singapore, gained independence from the Department of Architecture. In line with this transformation, we designed the division's identity, brand guidelines and a retrospective book to celebrate their 2010 - 2011 achievements.

item.title: Tapeart for Nike Stadium Berlin
item.description: We made some Tapeartworks for Nike Stadium Berlin around the whole city and on a Truck with a DJ inside with the purpose to support a run by the Graviteam Berlin. Thanks to Svenja and Eliza of Bold Agency and very special thanks to Bärbel of Letters are my friends!
item.content:encoded: We made some Tapeartworks for Nike Stadium Berlin around the whole city and on a Truck with a DJ inside with the purpose to support a run by the Graviteam Berlin. Thanks to Svenja and Eliza of Bold Agency and very special thanks to Bärbel of Letters are my friends!

item.title: Mollet del Vallès General Hospital
item.description: First of all, by taking advantage of the slope of the site, the new Public General Hospital was approached as a predominantly horizontal structure with volumes that unfold over the terrain in a staggered sequence as a way by which to reduce the visual impact of the building. Secondly, the volumes are organized around interior garden patios that provide light and ventilation. Finally, a large public plaza has been placed at the main entrance of the hospital where a huge ancient oak tree has been conserved. The plaza is a fundamental element of the design in that it penetrates inside the hospital where it is integrated into a circulation space that recalls a rambla the traditional pedestrian promenade that characterizes Catalan cities acting as a link between the city and the buildings interior. The hierarchy established in the circulation zones guarantees fluid movement for all the users of the building as well as its correct management. Moreover, it is a flexible system that can be adapted to different functional demands in the future.
item.content:encoded: First of all, by taking advantage of the slope of the site, the new Public General Hospital was approached as a predominantly horizontal structure with volumes that unfold over the terrain in a staggered sequence as a way by which to reduce the visual impact of the building. Secondly, the volumes are organized around interior garden patios that provide light and ventilation. Finally, a large public plaza has been placed at the main entrance of the hospital where a huge ancient oak tree has been conserved. The plaza is a fundamental element of the design in that it penetrates inside the hospital where it is integrated into a circulation space that recalls a rambla the traditional pedestrian promenade that characterizes Catalan cities acting as a link between the city and the buildings interior. The hierarchy established in the circulation zones guarantees fluid movement for all the users of the building as well as its correct management. Moreover, it is a flexible system that can be adapted to different functional demands in the future.
